key.name: first-start
key.summary: An internal key that must not be changed manually
key.description: Whether this is the first start of the extension or not. It is used to display a welcome message and/or open preferences.

key.name: enable-audible-bell
key.description: Whether to enable audible confirmation in terminal.

key.name: enable-animation
key.description: Whether to enable or disable the opening/closing animation.

key.name: opening-animation-time
key.summary: The opening animation time in ms
key.description: The opening animation time in milliseconds or zero for no opening animation.

key.name: closing-animation-time
key.summary: The closing animation time in ms
key.description: The closing animation time in milliseconds or zero for no closing animation.

key.name: transparent-terminal
key.description: Whether to enable terminal transparency (true) or keep the terminal opaque (false).

key.name: transparency-level
key.description: The transparency level between 0 (fully transparent) and 100 (fully opaque), which is only used if 'transparent-terminal' is set.

key.name: foreground-color
key.description: The terminal foreground color for normal text as hexadecimal value in the form "#rgb", "#rrggbb", "#rrrgggbbb" or "#rrrrggggbbbb".

key.name: background-color
key.description: The terminal background color as hexadecimal value in the form "#rgb", "#rrggbb", "#rrrgggbbb" or "#rrrrggggbbbb".

key.name: scrollbar-visible
key.description: Whether the terminal scrollbar is visible (true) or hidden (false).

key.name: terminal-size
key.description: The terminal window size in pixels (400px for instance) or in percentage (30% for instance). The size value is used for the height or width if the position is top/bottom, or left/right.

key.name: terminal-left-padding
key.description: The terminal window left padding in pixels (400px for instance) or in percentage (30% for instance).

key.name: terminal-right-padding
key.description: The terminal window right padding in pixels (400px for instance) or in percentage (30% for instance).

key.name: terminal-top-padding
key.description: The terminal window top padding in pixels (400px for instance) or in percentage (30% for instance).

key.name: terminal-bottom-padding
key.description: The terminal window bottom padding in pixels (400px for instance) or in percentage (30% for instance).

key.name: terminal-position
key.description: The edge of the screen to which the terminal window is aligned.

key.name: terminal-cursor
key.description: The type of the cursor used by the terminal.

key.name: other-shortcut
key.summary: The manual shortcut used to toggle the terminal
key.description: The shortcut used to open and close the terminal.

key.name: new-tab-shortcut
key.summary: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab
key.description: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab

key.name: prev-tab-shortcut
key.summary: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab
key.description: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab

key.name: next-tab-shortcut
key.summary: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab
key.description: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab

key.name: close-tab-shortcut
key.summary: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab
key.description: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab

key.name: increase-text-shortcut
key.summary: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab
key.description: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab

key.name: decrease-text-shortcut
key.summary: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab
key.description: Shortcut used to toggle open new terminal tab

key.name: enable-toggle-on-scroll
key.summary: Enable toggling by scrolling the top bar
key.description: Whether to enable toggling by scrolling on the top bar of the primary screen.

key.name: run-custom-command
key.summary: Whether to run a custom command or the default
key.description: Whether to use the custom command set in the 'custom-command' key or not (the user shell is used instead).

key.name: custom-command
key.description: The custom command to launch in the terminal, only used if the 'run-custom-command' key value is 'true'.

key.name: enable-tabs
key.description: Whether to enable or disable the tabs

key.name: hide-on-unfocus
key.description: Whether to enable or disable the "hide on unfocus" feature

key.name: hide-on-escape
key.description: Whether to enable or disable the "hide on escape" feature

key.name: primary-monitor
key.description: Specifies the index of the primary monitor (-1 = GNOME Primary Monitor).

key.name: multi-monitor-mode
key.description: Display terminal on all monitors

key.name: tabs-position
key.description: Specifies the the edge to draw the tabs at.

key.name: scroll-on-output
key.description: Controls whether or not the terminal will forcibly scroll to the bottom of the viewable history when the new data is received.

key.name: motr-version
key.summary: The last shown message of release message
key.description: Value must be equal to extension version to MOTR disappear

key.name: toggle-fullscreen-shortcut
key.description: Shortcut used to toggle fullscreen

key.name: capture-focus-shortcut
key.description: Shortcut used to toggle focus

key.summary: Open new terminal in current directory
key.description: Open new terminal in current directory
